meanings.definition: A sighting device used in surveying and navigation.
meanings.sent1: The alidads helped the explorer find the right direction.
meanings.sent2: Surveyors rely on alidads to measure angles accurately.
meanings.sent3: The alidads decided to take a break and go sightseeing instead.
meanings.sent4: Her sharp eyes were like alidads, always pointing her in the right way.
meanings.sent5: The alidads gleamed in the sunlight, guiding the ship safely through the waters.

meanings.definition: The plural form of alidad, a type of surveying instrument.
meanings.sent1: The toolbox was filled with various alidads for different measurements.
meanings.sent2: Surveyors carried their alidads in sturdy cases for protection.
meanings.sent3: The alidads gathered together for a group photo, posing with their lenses.
meanings.sent4: His collection of alidads was a testament to his passion for surveying.
meanings.sent5: Each of the alidads had a unique design, reflecting the craftsmanship of the instrument makers.
